He said the situation has brought about untold hardships on the ordinary Ghanaian, as most businesses in the private sector are collapsing from erratic power supply, coupled with the increasing rate of unemployment among the youth, especially university graduates. 
Owusu Ansah made the observation at the official launching of Young Elephant Fun Club at Tafo Ahenbronum, a suburb of Kumasi, during which he entreated the NPP followers to focus on Nana Akufo-Addo and embark on decent and genuine electioneering campaigns, devoid of insults against political opponents. 
He stressed on the need to work to attract the floating voters to ensure a massive win for the NPP. Mr. Kingsley Abeyie, aka Makaby, National Chairman of Young Elephant, gave the assurance that the group would not leave any stone unturned to ensure that the NPP wins power in the 2016 elections to salvage Ghanaians from the prevailing hardships in the country. 
Muhammed Bashir Tijani, aka Obaadaben, National Organiser of Young Elephant, re-affirmed that the NPP is a national party, and that its followers should disabuse their minds that it is an Akan party. 
The Young Elephant National Organiser rubbished the one million voters target by the NDC in the Ashanti Region, claiming the Young Elephants are targeting to win about 96% of the total votes in the region. 
According to him, the group intends to mobilise about 94,000 youth in the Ashanti Region, and 520,000 nationwide, to ensure a massive win to improve their living standards in health, education and infrastructural development. Ghana
